Uses of Class
pulse.util.Accessible

  • Packages that use Accessible 
    Package Description
    pulse
    Contains some of the most frequently used classes, which did not seem to fit in any other packages.
    pulse.input
    Introduces internal data structures that (a) are created as a result of parsing specific types of input files, such as: experimental heating curves, metadata, and property curves (e.g.
    pulse.problem.schemes
    This package deals with anything associated with finite differences in PULsE, including the definition of Grids, which define the partitioning rules for space and time variables, the discretised Pulse on any of those grids, and finite-difference schemes, which subclass DifferenceScheme.
    pulse.problem.schemes.solvers  
    pulse.problem.statements
    Introduces various problem statements for the heat conduction problem in the laser flash experiment.
    pulse.search.direction
    Provides a list of PathSolvers and associated classes, which are used to determine the direction of the minimum of a specific SearchTask using an iterative approach.
    pulse.search.linear
    Provides classes that are able to search for the minimum of a scalar function of a vector variable that is unimodal on a specific Segment.
    pulse.tasks
    Introduces the SearchTask, which is the main actor in PULsE, and the TaskManager, a high-level class which among other functions manages loading and executing SearchTasks.
    pulse.util
    Contains abstract data and hierarchical structures that implement much of the Java Reflection API.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Baseline
      A Baseline is determined by its baselineType and two parameters: intercept and slope.
      class  HeatingCurve
      The HeatingCurve represents a time-temperature profile either resulting from a finite-difference calculation or measured directly in the experiment (and then it is called ExperimentalData).

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.input

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.input 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ExperimentalData
      An ExperimentalData object is essentially a HeatingCurve with adjustable fitting range and linked Metadata.
      class  Metadata
      Metadata is the information relating to a specific experiment, which is required to accurately process the ExperimentalData.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.problem.schemes

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.problem.schemes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ADIScheme  
      class  DifferenceScheme
      A DifferenceScheme is defined as a sequence of algebraic operations on a Grid that is used to calculate the solution of a Problem.
      class  ExplicitScheme
      This class implements the simple explicit finite-difference scheme (also called the forward-time centered space scheme) for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.
      class  Grid
      A Grid is used to partition the space and time domain of a Problem to allow a numeric solution with a DifferenceScheme.
      class  Grid2D
      A Grid2D is used to partition the space and time domain of a Problem2D to allow a numeric solution with a DifferenceScheme.
      class  ImplicitScheme
      This class implements the fully implicit finite-difference scheme for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.
      class  MixedScheme
      This class implements a symmetric (weight = 0.5) second-order in time Crank-Nicolson semi-implicit finite-difference scheme for solving the one-dimensional heat conduction problem.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.problem.schemes.solvers

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.problem.schemes.solvers 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ADILinearisedSolver  
      class  ExplicitLinearisedSolver
      Performs a fully-dimensionless calculation for the LinearisedProblem.
      class  ExplicitNonlinearSolver  
      class  ExplicitTranslucentSolver  
      class  ImplicitDiathermicSolver  
      class  ImplicitLinearisedSolver
      Performs a fully-dimensionless calculation for the LinearisedProblem.
      class  ImplicitNonlinearSolver  
      class  ImplicitTranslucentSolver  
      class  MixedLinearisedSolver
      Performs a fully-dimensionless calculation for the LinearisedProblem.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.problem.statements

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.problem.statements 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  AbsorptionModel  
      class  BeerLambertAbsorption  
      class  DiathermicMaterialProblem  
      class  Insulator  
      class  LinearisedProblem
      The simplest problem statement supported in PULsE, which is formulated in the dimensionless form and with linearised boundary conditions.
      class  LinearisedProblem2D  
      class  NonlinearProblem  
      class  Problem
      A Problem is an abstract class defining the general rules for handling heat conduction problems, and also providing access to the basic properties used in the calculation with one of the DifferenceSchemes.
      class  Problem2D  
      class  Pulse
      A Pulse stores the parameters of the laser pulse, but does not provide the calculation facilities.
      class  TranslucentMaterialProblem  

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.search.direction

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.search.direction 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ApproximatedHessianOptimiser
      The 'advanced' PathSolver implementing the variable-metric (quasi-Newton) search method.
      class  PathOptimiser
      An abstract class that defines the mathematical basis of solving the reverse heat conduction problem.
      class  SteepestDescentOptimiser
      The simplest possible PathSolver, which assumes that the minimum direction coincides with the inverted gradient.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.search.linear

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.search.linear 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  GoldenSectionOptimiser
      The golden-section search is a simple dichotomy search for finding the minimum of strictly unimodal functions by successively narrowing the domain of the search using the golden ratio partitioning.
      class  LinearOptimiser
      The most basic LinearSolver class, which defines the notion of the linear resolution, defines the method signature for estimating the step of the linear search (i.e., the position of the minimum), and provides a simple algorithm to initialise the calculation domain.
      class  WolfeOptimiser
      This is the implementation of the strong Wolfe conditions for performing inexact linear search.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.tasks

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.tasks 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Buffer
      A Buffer is used to estimate the convergence of the reverse problem solution, by comparing the variance of the properties to a pre-specified error tolerance.
      class  SearchTask
      A SearchTask is the most important class in PULsE.

    • Uses of Accessible in pulse.util

      Subclasses of Accessible in pulse.util 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  PropertyHolder
      An Accessible that has a list of parameters it accepts as its own and a list of PropertyHolderListener that track changes with all properties of the Accessible.
      Methods in pulse.util that return types with arguments of type Accessible 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<Accessible> Accessible.accessibleChildren()
      Selects only those Accessibles, the parent of which is this.
